meanings.sent1: I found a beautiful concha on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The concha was delicate and colorful.
meanings.sent3: The hermit crab moved into the concha and made it a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The concha whispered secrets of the ocean to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The child held the concha to their ear, imagining the sound of waves.

meanings.definition: A type of Mexican sweet bread.
meanings.sent1: I love the sweet aroma of freshly baked concha.
meanings.sent2: In Mexico, concha is a popular treat for breakfast.
meanings.sent3: The concha smiled at the other pastries in the bakery.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as warm and comforting as a concha.
meanings.sent5: The concha melted in my mouth, leaving a sugary bliss behind.

meanings.definition: The outer part of the ear.
meanings.sent1: She wore earrings that dangled just above her concha.
meanings.sent2: The concha protects the delicate inner ear.
meanings.sent3: The wind whispered secrets that only the concha could hear.
meanings.sent4: His words fell on her concha, unheard and ignored.
meanings.sent5: The concha tingled as she listened intently to the music.
